translated: In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie in regard to any of the three elements, but the underlying tendency to ignorance does underlie in him in regard to the unincluded.

original: ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti avijjā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāmarāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: Or, when the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie a given state, does the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires not underlie it?

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha mānānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: When the underlying tendency to resentment does not underlie a given state, does the underlying tendency to conceit not underlie it?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha
translated: In the case of the three kinds of persons in the sense sphere and in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres,

original: paṭighānusayo nānuseti, no ca tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ
analyzed: paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tesam tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalāna
translated: the underlying tendency to resentment does not underlie them, but the underlying tendency to conceit does. In the case of the same three kinds of persons

original: apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo ca nānuseti. Anāgāmissa
analyzed: apariyāpanne tesam tattha paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti māna anusayo ca na anuseti anāgāmissa
translated: in the unincluded, the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit both underlie them. In the case of a non-returner

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti,
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti
translated: in the sense sphere and in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, the underlying tendency to resentment does not underlie them,🔽but the underlying tendency to conceit does. In the case of the same non-returner in painful feeling and in the unincluded,

original: no ca tassa tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne
analyzed: no ca tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne
translated: the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit both do not underlie them.

original: tassa tattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha
analyzed: tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na anuseti māna anusayaḥ ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha
translated: In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned, the underlying tendency to conceit is not yet abandoned. In the case of an Arahant,

original: paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na anuseti māna anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned, and the underlying tendency to conceit is not yet abandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha mānānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to conceit is not yet abandoned, is the underlying tendency to resistance not yet abandoned?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tesam  tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesaṃ eva puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha māna anusayo
translated: In the case of three kinds of persons in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to conceit is not yet abandoned, but the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned.

original: ca nānuseti paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha mānānusayo ca nānuseti paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha māna anusayo ca na anuseti paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of these same three kinds of persons in the imperturbable, the underlying tendency to conceit is not yet abandoned and the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned. In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to conceit is not yet abandoned and the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayaḥ pe vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned, is the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to doubt not yet abandoned?

original: Puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha paṭighānusayo
analyzed: puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in the sense-desire element and in two of the feelings in the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to resistance is not yet abandoned,

original: nānuseti, no ca tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne🔽tassa tattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ
analyzed: na anuseti no ca tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa a pariyāpanne  tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti dvinnam puggalāna
translated: in the case of the other two, the fetter of resistance does not follow along, but the fetter of uncertainty does.🔽In the case of the other two, the fetter of resistance does follow along and the fetter of uncertainty does as well.

original: sabbattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: sabbattha paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of the first two, the fetter of resistance does follow along and the fetter of uncertainty does as well.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānusetīti?🔽Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti, no ca
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti iti  dvinnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca
translated: Or, in whatever instance the fetter of uncertainty does not follow along, does the fetter of resistance not follow along there too?🔽In the case of the first two, the fetter of uncertainty does not follow along in the case of painful feeling, but the fetter of resistance does.

original: tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: In the case of the other two, the fetter of uncertainty does not follow along in the case of the two pleasant feelings in the sense-desire realm,

original: rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti paṭighānusayo
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā apariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti paṭigha anusayo
translated: but the fetter of resistance does. In the case of the two pleasant feelings in the fine-material and immaterial realms and in the case of the unincluded, the fetter of uncertainty does not follow along and the fetter of resistance does.

original: ca nānuseti. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ sabbattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti dvinnam puggalānam sabbattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of the first two, the fetter of uncertainty does not follow along and the fetter of resistance does as well.

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: “When anyone’s aversion-obsession does not obsess him with regard to anything, does his lust-obsession obsess him with regard to that?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti, no🔽ca tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti no  ca tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: “With regard to the form element and the formless element, the aversion-obsession of three persons does not obsess them,🔽but their lust-obsession does obsess them.

original: vedanāsu apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: vedanāsu apariyāpanne tesam tattha paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: “With regard to the sensuality element and two of the feelings, the aversion-obsession and the lust-obsession of those same three persons do not obsess them.

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti, no ca tassa
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tassa
translated: “With regard to the form element and the formless element, the aversion-obsession of a non-returner does not obsess him,🔽but his lust-obsession does obsess him.

original: tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne
analyzed: tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne
translated: “With regard to the sensuality element and the three feelings, the aversion-obsession and the lust-obsession of that same person do not obsess him.

original: tassa tattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha🔽paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti arahataḥ sabbattha 🔽paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na anuseti bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: “With regard to all , the aversion-obsession and the lust-obsession of an arahant do not obsess him.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānusetīti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti, no ca
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti iti  tiṇṇam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca
translated: Or, where the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to resistance underlie there?🔽In the case of the three kinds of persons in painful feeling, there the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie,

original: tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: but there the underlying tendency to resistance does not not underlie. In the case of those same three kinds of persons in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the four kinds of feeling in the immaterial sphere,

original: apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: apariyāpanne tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: there the underlying tendency to lust for being and the underlying tendency to resistance both do not underlie.

original: Arahato sabbattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: arahato sabbattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of the Arahant in all kinds of feeling, there the underlying tendency to lust for being and the underlying tendency to resistance both do not underlie.

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: Where the underlying tendency to resistance does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to ignorance underlie there?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha
translated: In the case of the three kinds of persons in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the four kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, there

original: paṭighānusayo nānuseti, no ca tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ
analyzed: paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tesam tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalāna
translated: the underlying tendency to resistance does not underlie, but there the underlying tendency to ignorance does not not underlie. In the case of those same three kinds of persons

original: apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti. Anāgāmissa
analyzed: apariyāpanne tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na anuseti avijjā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti anāgāmissa
translated: in the inconcrete, the underlying tendency to resistance does not underlie that, but the underlying tendency to ignorance does underlie that.

original: kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti,
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti
translated: In the case of one on the path of non-returner, the underlying tendency to resistance does not underlie that in the three kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, in the fine-material sphere, and in the immaterial sphere,

original: no ca tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa tattha🔽paṭighānusayo ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha paṭighānusayo
analyzed: no ca tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa a pariyāpanne tassa tattha  paṭigha anusayo ca na anuseti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha paṭigha anusayo
translated: but the underlying tendency to ignorance does underlie that. In the case of that same person, the underlying tendency to resistance does underlie that🔽in the inconcrete, and the underlying tendency to ignorance does underlie that. In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to resistance does not underlie that

original: ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti avijjā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: anywhere, and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie that anywhere.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha paṭighānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha mānānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā  yassa yattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayaḥ pe vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: Or alternatively, in the case of anyone, the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie that in the three kinds of feeling in the immaterial sphere,🔽but the underlying tendency to resistance does not underlie that in the three kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and fine-material sphere.🔽In the case of any given person, in the three kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and fine-material sphere, the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie that, but the underlying tendency to false view … to doubt does not underlie that.

original: Puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha mānānusayo nānuseti, no ca tassa tattha
analyzed: puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tassa tattha
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie that, but the underlying tendency to

original: vicikicchānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa tattha mānānusayo
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa tattha māna anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie that.🔽In the case of the same person, in the inconstant, the underlying tendency to conceit

original: ca nānuseti vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha mānānusayo ca nānuseti
analyzed: ca na anuseti vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha māna anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not underlie that. In the case of an Arahant, in all, the underlying tendency to conceit

original: vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not underlie that.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha mānānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: Or, in the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie any state, does the underlying tendency to conceit not underlie that state?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha
translated: In the case of three persons, in the sense-desire element and in two kinds of feeling, in the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: vicikicchānusayo nānuseti, no ca tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tesam tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tesaṃ eva puggalāna
translated: does not underlie that, but the underlying tendency to conceit does.

original: dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti māna anusayo
translated: In the case of those same persons, in painful feeling, in the inconstant, the underlying tendency to uncertainty🔽and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie that. In the case of an Arahant, in all, the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti māna anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie that.

original: Yassa yattha mānānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie any state, does the underlying tendency to lust for being not underlie that state?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha mānānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: Or, where the underlying tendency to passion for being does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to conceit not underlie there too?

original: Catunnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti,
analyzed: catunnam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti
translated: In the case of the four persons, the underlying tendency to passion for being does not underlie in the sense-desire element and in two kinds of feeling,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne
translated: but the underlying tendency to conceit does not not underlie there. In the case of those same four persons in painful feeling and in the unincluded,

original: tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha
analyzed: tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti māna anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha
translated: the underlying tendency to passion for being and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie. In the case of the Arahant,

original: bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti mānānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca na anuseti māna anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to passion for being and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie.

original: Yassa yattha mānānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: Where the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to ignorance not underlie there too?

original: Catunnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: catunnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tesam
translated: In the case of the four persons in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie there,

original: tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo
analyzed: tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tesaṃ eva puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha māna anusayo
translated: but the underlying tendency to ignorance does not not underlie there. In the case of those same four persons in the unincluded, the underlying tendency to conceit

original: ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha mānānusayo ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha māna anusayo ca na anuseti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie them. In an Arahant, in all instances, the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie them, and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha mānānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: Or, in any instance where the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie, in that instance the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie?

original: Yassa yattha diṭṭhānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha diṭṭha anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā  yassa yattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo na anuseti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: In any instance where the underlying tendency to false view does not underlie, in that instance the underlying tendency to doubt does not underlie?🔽Or, in any instance where the underlying tendency to doubt does not underlie, in that instance the underlying tendency to false view does not underlie?🔽In any instance where the underlying tendency to false view … to doubt does not underlie, in that instance the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti,
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti
translated: In the case of three persons, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to doubt does not underlie them,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā tīsu
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā tīsu
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for being does not not underlie them. In the case of those same three persons, in the sensual dhammas of the sense sphere,

original: vedanāsu apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti bhavarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: vedanāsu apariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti bhava rāga anusayo ca
translated: In the case of those who have not abandoned the fetter of doubt in regard to feeling, the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that has not been abandoned, and the underlying tendency to lust for being has not been abandoned.

original: nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: na anuseti arahato sabbattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to uncertainty in regard to that has been abandoned, and the underlying tendency to lust for being has been abandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: But is it only the underlying tendency to lust for being that has not been abandoned in the case of those in whom the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned?

original: Puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti, no
analyzed: puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti no
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in the sense sphere in regard to the three kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to lust for being has not been abandoned in him,

original: ca tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa
analyzed: ca tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa a pariyāpanne tassa
translated: but the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned. In the case of one who has not abandoned the fetter of doubt in regard to the imperturbable,

original: tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha
analyzed: tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for being has not been abandoned in him, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned. In the case of an Arahant,

original: bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca na anuseti vicikicchā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for being has been abandoned, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: Is it only the underlying tendency to uncertainty that has not been abandoned in those in whom the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha🔽vicikicchānusayo nānuseti, no ca tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ🔽apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha  vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti no ca tesam tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tesaṃ eva puggalāna  a pariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of the three persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the form element and in the formless element,🔽but the underlying tendency to ignorance does underlie them. In the case of those same persons,🔽the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to ignorance underlie the unincluded.

original: Arahato sabbattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: arahato sabbattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti avijjā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti  yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: In the case of the Arahant, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to ignorance do not underlie any of the three elements.🔽Or, in the case of anyone, where the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to uncertainty not underlie there too?

original: Yassa yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: In the case of anyone, where the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to ignorance not underlie there too?

original: Catunnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti,
analyzed: catunnam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti
translated: In the case of the four persons, the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tesaṃ eva puggalānam a pariyāpanne
translated: but the underlying tendency to ignorance does underlie them. In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to lust for being and the underlying tendency to ignorance underlie the unincluded.

original: tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha bhavarāgānusayo
analyzed: tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha bhava rāga anusayo
translated: Herein, the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie, and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie. In an Arahant, the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie,

original: ca nānuseti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: ca na anuseti avijjā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā ekamūlaka
translated: Or, in any case, where the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie, does the underlying tendency to lust for being not underlie there too?

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha mānānusayo nānusetīti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti iti  tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam a pariyāpanne
translated: In any case, where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desire and the underlying tendency to resentment do not underlie, does the underlying tendency to conceit not underlie there too?🔽In the case of the three kinds of persons in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desire and the underlying tendency to resentment do not underlie there, but the underlying tendency to conceit does underlie there.

original: tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti mānānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti māna anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of those same three kinds of persons in the unincluded dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desire and the underlying tendency to resentment do not underlie there, and the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie there.

original: Anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of a non-returner in the sense-desire element and in two of the feelings in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desire and the underlying tendency to resentment do not underlie there,🔽but the underlying tendency to conceit does underlie there.

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa🔽dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha māna anusayo na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa  dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie that neither does the underlying tendency to conceit underlie that.

original: mānānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti🔽mānānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: māna anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti  ca na anuseti
translated: In the case of the third person, the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling that is not included in the cognitive series,

original: Yassa vā pana yattha mānānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusentīti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti iti  tiṇṇam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha māna anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: but the underlying tendency to conceit does underlie that. In the case of the arahat, the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie any feeling,🔽and the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie any feeling.

original: nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne
analyzed: na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam a pariyāpanne
translated: But in the case of the third person, the underlying tendency to conceit underlies the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling that is not included in the cognitive series,

original: tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti.
analyzed: tesam tattha māna anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie that.

original: Arahato sabbattha mānānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti.
analyzed: arahataḥ sabbattha māna anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendencies to lust and to resentment do not lie behind any of the three kinds of feeling.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo na anuseti iti
translated: When anyone’s underlying tendency to lust and underlying tendency to resentment do not lie behind any of the three kinds of feeling, does his underlying tendency to false view … to conceit … to desire for being … to ignorance lie behind any of them?

original: Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne
analyzed: puthujjanassa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa apariyāpanne
translated: In the case of an ordinary man, the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment do not lie behind the fine-material and immaterial dhammas.🔽But his underlying tendency to uncertainty does lie behind them.🔽In the case of the same person, the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment do not lie behind the unincluded dhammas,

original: tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: and his underlying tendency to uncertainty does not lie behind them.

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam sabbattha pe
translated: In the case of two persons …

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusentīti?🔽Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti iti 🔽dvinnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: When anyone’s underlying tendency to uncertainty does not lie behind any of the three kinds of feeling, do his underlying tendencies to lust and to resentment lie behind any of them?🔽In the case of two persons …

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā
translated: nor does the underlying tendency to resistance underlie that in regard to them.🔽In the case of those same persons in the sense sphere,

original: dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca
translated: but their resentment does not underlie that. In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, their uncertainty and resentment do not underlie that,

original: tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā🔽apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā  apariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: but their lust does not underlie that. In the case of those same persons, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,

original: ca nānusenti. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: ca na anusenti dvinnam puggalānam sabbattha pe
translated: their uncertainty underlies that, but their lust and resentment do not underlie that. In the case of the remaining persons, in all these dhammas, their uncertainty, lust, and resentment do not underlie that.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti  tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the case of those in whom these underlying tendencies do not underlie these dhammas, do their underlying tendencies not underlie any other dhammas?🔽In the case of three persons, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, their lust and resentment do not underlie that,

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam apariyāpanne
translated: but their underlying tendency to lust for becoming underlies that. In the case of those same persons, in the dhammas not included in the three planes, their lust and resentment do not underlie that,🔽but their underlying tendency to lust for becoming underlies that.

original: tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: in the case of those subject to perversion by sensual desire, the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie that, and the underlying tendency to aversion does not underlie that.

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the case of a non-returner in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie that,

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for being does not not underlie that. In the case of that same person in the sense-sphere dhammas,

original: tīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti
analyzed: tīsu vedanāsu apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: in the three kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie that, and the underlying tendency to aversion does not underlie that,🔽but the underlying tendency to lust for being does not not underlie that. In the case of an arahat in all dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie that,

original: bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti arahataḥ sabbattha pe
translated: and the underlying tendency to aversion does not underlie that, and the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie that.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusentīti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti iti  tiṇṇam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: Or alternatively, in the case of any person in any dhammas in which the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie them, the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie them,🔽and the underlying tendency to aversion does not underlie them. In the case of three persons in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to lust for being does not underlie that,

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā
translated: and the underlying tendency to lust does not underlie that, but the underlying tendency to aversion does not not underlie that. In the case of those same persons in the sense-sphere dhammas,

original: dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca
translated: in two kinds of feelings, the underlying tendency to passion for being and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie those feelings,

original: tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tesaṃ eva puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust does not not underlie those feelings. In the case of those same persons, in the incon-ceivable,

original: bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti. Arahato sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti arahato sabbattha pe
translated: the underlying tendency to passion for being does not underlie those feelings, but the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie those feelings. In the case of an Arahant, in all instances,🔽the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie any feelings, and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not not underlie those feelings.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti
translated: In regard to those whose underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie any given states, does the underlying tendency to ignorance underlie those states?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the case of three persons, in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resistance

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam a pariyāpanne
translated: do not underlie those states, but the underlying tendency to ignorance does not not underlie those states. In the case of those same persons, in the incon-ceivable,

original: tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie those states, and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie those states.

original: Anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva
analyzed: anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo  ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva
translated: In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet free of passion for the immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.

original: puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti🔽avijjānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti  avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti arahataḥ sabbattha pe
translated: In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusentīti? Āmantā. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti iti āmantā dukamūlaka  yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet free of passion for the immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet free of passion for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the fine-material and immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusentīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti iti
translated: In one not yet free of passion for the immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for the immaterial dhammas does not underlie those dhammas, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires does underlie those dhammas.🔽In one not yet

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of the two persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva🔽puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti. Tesaññeva
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayo na anuseti tesam eva  puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti tesam eva
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie those painful feelings, but the underlying tendency to resistance does underlie them.🔽In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit do underlie them.

original: puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva
analyzed: puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo  ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha māna anusayo na anuseti tesam eva
translated: In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie the two elements, the element of form and the formless element, but the underlying tendency to conceit does underlie them.

original: puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie the unincluded, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie it.

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti. Anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: In the case of the non-returner, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resistance do not underlie the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element,

original: rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya
translated: In the case of the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment

original: vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: do not underlie them, but the underlying tendency to conceit does underlie them. In the case of the painful feeling of the same person, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit

original: paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti. Arahato sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti arahato sabbattha pe
translated: do not underlie it, but the underlying tendency to lust for existence does underlie it. In the case of all dhammas of the Arahant, the underlying tendencies do not underlie them.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: When anyone’s underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and his underlying tendency to resentment and his underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie any dhamma, does his underlying tendency to lust for existence not underlie it too?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusentīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti iti
translated: Or when anyone’s underlying tendency to lust for existence does not underlie any dhamma, do his underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and his underlying tendency to resentment and his underlying tendency to conceit not underlie it too?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of the painful feeling of three persons, the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment

original: ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva🔽puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayo na anuseti tesam eva  puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: but the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie that.🔽In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to resentment do not underlie the two pleasant feeling-tones in the sense-desire realm,

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti. Tesaññeva🔽puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca🔽paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti. Anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti tesam eva  puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca  paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie those two.🔽In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to lust for existence does not underlie the undetermined,🔽but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure, the underlying tendency to resentment, and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie that.🔽In the case of a non-returner, the underlying tendency to lust for existence, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure, and the underlying tendency to resentment do not underlie the two pleasant feeling-tones in the sense-desire realm,

original: tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa
analyzed: tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa
translated: but the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie those two.

original: tattha mānānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa
analyzed: tattha māna anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa
translated: In the case of that same person, the underlying tendency to lust for existence does not underlie painful feeling-tone and the undetermined,

original: tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure, the underlying tendency to resentment, and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie that.

original: ca nānusenti. Arahato sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: ca na anusenti arahataḥ sabbattha pe
translated: … in the case of an Arahant in all cases.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?🔽Anāgāmissa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo🔽ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti  anāgāmissa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo  ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa a pariyāpanne
translated: In the case of anyone in whom the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires, the inherent tendency to aversion, and the inherent tendency to conceit are not unabandoned, has the inherent tendency to ignorance unabandoned?🔽In the case of one who is a non-returner in the case of painful feeling, the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires, the inherent tendency to aversion, and the inherent tendency to conceit are unabandoned in him but the inherent tendency to ignorance is unabandoned in him.

original: tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti avijjānusayo
analyzed: tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti avijjā anusayo
translated: In the case of that same person in the case of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires, the inherent tendency to aversion, and the inherent tendency to conceit are unabandoned in him but the inherent tendency to ignorance is unabandoned in him.

original: ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha …pe….
analyzed: ca na anuseti arahataḥ sabbattha pe
translated: … in the case of an Arahant in all cases.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusentīti? Āmantā. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti iti āmantā tikamūlaka
translated: In the case of anyone in whom the inherent tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, are the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires, the inherent tendency to aversion, and the inherent tendency to conceit unabandoned in him? In the case of the first three persons, the inherent tendency to ignorance is unabandoned in them but the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires, the inherent tendency to aversion, and the inherent tendency to conceit are unabandoned in them.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: When, in a certain realm, the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views do not accompany, in that realm the underlying tendency to doubt does not accompany.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusentīti?🔽Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti.🔽Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti iti  dvinnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo  ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayo na anuseti  tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca
translated: Or when, in a certain realm, the underlying tendency to doubt does not accompany, in that realm the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views do not accompany.🔽In the case of two persons in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views do not accompany, but the underlying tendency to aversion accompanies.

original: paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti.
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: In the case of those same two persons in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to aversion do not accompany, but the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit accompany.

original: Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: tesam eva puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo nānuseti.
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha māna anusayo na anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to views, do not underlie in the form element and the formless element, but the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie in them.

original: Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: tesam eva puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of those same persons, the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie in the unincluded, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti. Anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā🔽dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā  dvīsu vedanāsu rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views do not underlie in it. In the case of a non-returner, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha mānānusayo nānuseti.
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha māna anusayo na anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to views do not underlie in the sense-desire element, in two kinds of feeling, in the form element, and in the formless element, but the underlying tendency to conceit does not underlie in them.

original: Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca
analyzed: tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca
translated: In the case of that same person, the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie in painful feeling and in the unincluded, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires,

original: nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti.
analyzed: na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views do not underlie in it.

original: Arahato sabbattha vicikicchānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca
analyzed: arahato sabbattha vicikicchā anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca
translated: In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to uncertainty does not underlie anything, and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion do not underlie anything.

original: mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca nānusenti …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo nānusetīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca na anusenti pe catukkamūlaka  yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti iti āmantā
translated: The underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views do not underlie anything. … (The fourfold root.)🔽“In the case of those in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not underlie anything, does the underlying tendency to lust for existence underlie anything for them or not?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca nānusentīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca na anusenti iti
translated: “In the case of those in whom the underlying tendency to lust for existence does not underlie anything, does the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires underlie anything for them or not?

original: Puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: “In the case of an ordinary person in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires do not underlie anything for him,

original: mānānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: māna anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: but the underlying tendency to aversion and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do underlie something for him.

original: ca nānusenti. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca na anusenti tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo
translated: in the sense sphere, in two kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to passion for existence and the underlying tendency to repulsion do not underlie those states,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca🔽diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca nānusenti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa🔽tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca  diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca na anusenti tassa iva puggalassa a pariyāpanne tassa  tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit do not underlie those states. In the case of the same person, in the imperturbable,

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca nānusenti. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya🔽tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca na anusenti dvinnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya  tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to passion for existence does not underlie those states, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to repulsion and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not underlie those states. In the case of two persons, in painful feeling,

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo nānuseti. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ na anuseti tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā
translated: the underlying tendency to passion for existence and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not underlie those states, but the underlying tendency to repulsion does not underlie those states. In the case of those same persons, in the sense sphere,

original: dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: in the two kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to passion for being and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: ca nānusenti, no ca tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca nānusenti. Tesaññeva🔽puggalānaṁ apariyāpanne tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: ca na anusenti no ca tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na anusenti tesam eva  puggalānam apariyāpanne tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: are not present, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit are not present there.🔽In the case of those same persons, in the inconstant, the underlying tendency to passion for being is not present,

original: paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca nānusenti. Anāgāmissa
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca na anusenti anāgāmissa
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are not present there. In the case of a non-returner,

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: in the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to passion for being and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa tattha mānānusayo nānuseti.
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa tattha māna anusayo na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are not present, but the underlying tendency to conceit is not present there.🔽In the case of that same person, in painful feeling and in the inconstant, the underlying tendency to passion for being

original: Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya apariyāpanne tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca
translated: and

original: nānuseti kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: na anuseti kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt,

original: ca nānusenti. Arahato sabbattha …pe…. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: ca na anusenti arahataḥ sabbattha pe pañcakamūlaka
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not accompany it. In an Arahant, in all cases … (as for the first pair) … (The fivefold version is to be expanded in the same way as the fourfold version.)

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca nānusenti tassa tattha avijjānusayo nānusetīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na anusenti tassa tattha avijjā anusayo na anuseti iti
translated: When someone’s underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, to aversion, to conceit, to views, and to uncertainty does not accompany something, does his underlying tendency to ignorance not accompany it too?

original: Anāgāmissa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In one who is not fully freed from lust, aversion, and delusion, in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit,🔽the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty do not accompany it, but his underlying tendency to ignorance accompanies it.🔽In the same person, in the neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that is not included in the fine-material sphere, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca nānusenti, no ca tassa
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na anusenti no ca tassa
translated: the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence do not accompany it, but his underlying tendency to ignorance accompanies it.

original: tattha avijjānusayo nānuseti. Tasseva puggalassa apariyāpanne tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: tattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa iva puggalassa a pariyāpanne tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the same person, in the neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that is included in the fine-material sphere, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to lust for existence, and the underlying tendency to ignorance do not accompany it.

original: ca nānusenti avijjānusayo ca nānuseti. Arahato sabbattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: ca na anusenti avijjā anusayo ca na anuseti arahato sabbattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the case of an Arahant, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion,

original: ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca nānusenti
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na anusenti
translated: the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence do not underlie,

original: avijjānusayo ca nānuseti.
analyzed: avijjā anusayaḥ ca na anuseti
translated: and the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo nānuseti tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ na anuseti tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: Or, in the case of anyone, wherever the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion,

original: ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca nānusentīti?
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na anusenti iti
translated: the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence do not underlie there.

original: Āmantā. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)🔽Anusayavāre paṭilomaṁ.
analyzed: āmantā chakkamūlaka  anusaya vāre paṭiloma
translated: The first section for recitation on the root of the unwholesome.🔽In the section on the underlying tendencies, in reverse order.

original: Anusayavāro.
analyzed: anusaya vāraḥ
translated: The section on the underlying tendencies.
